content.question: When a <math alttext="50, decimal point, milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is mixed with a <math alttext="50, decimal point, milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the resulting mixture has a volume of <math alttext="95 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the container is warm to the touch. Which of the following best describes these observations?

choices.label: A chemical reaction occurs, as evidenced by the volume of the resultant mixture being less than the total volume of the initial components.
A chemical change occurs, as evidenced by the formation of new covalent bonds releasing more energy than is absorbed by the breaking of the existing covalent bonds.
A physical change occurs, and the solvation process is exothermic.
A physical change occurs, and the solvation process is endothermic.

content.answer: A physical change occurs, and the solvation process is exothermic.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
